io.grpc.transport

Class MessageFramer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.grpc.transport.MessageFramer

  • public class MessageFramer
extends java.lang.Object
    Encodes gRPC messages to be delivered via the transport layer which implements MessageFramer.Sink.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MessageFramer.Compression 
      static interface  MessageFramer.Sink
      Sink implemented by the transport layer to receive frames and forward them to their destination.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageFramer(MessageFramer.Sink sink, WritableBufferAllocator bufferAllocator, int maxFrameSize)
      Creates a MessageFramer without compression.
      MessageFramer(MessageFramer.Sink sink, WritableBufferAllocator bufferAllocator, int maxFrameSize, MessageFramer.Compression compression)
      Creates a MessageFramer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Flushes and closes the framer and releases any buffers.
      void dispose()
      Closes the framer and releases any buffers, but does not flush.
      void flush()
      Flushes any buffered data in the framer to the sink.
      boolean isClosed()
      Indicates whether or not this framer has been closed via a call to either close() or dispose().
      void writePayload(java.io.InputStream message, int messageLength)
      Writes out a payload message.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageFramer

        public MessageFramer(MessageFramer.Sink sink,
                     WritableBufferAllocator bufferAllocator,
                     int maxFrameSize)
        Creates a MessageFramer without compression.
        Parameters:
        sink - the sink used to deliver frames to the transport
        maxFrameSize - the maximum frame size that this framer will deliver

      • MessageFramer

        public MessageFramer(MessageFramer.Sink sink,
                     WritableBufferAllocator bufferAllocator,
                     int maxFrameSize,
                     MessageFramer.Compression compression)
        Creates a MessageFramer.
        Parameters:
        sink - the sink used to deliver frames to the transport
        maxFrameSize - the maximum frame size that this framer will deliver
        compression - the compression type

    • Method Detail

      • writePayload

        public void writePayload(java.io.InputStream message,
                         int messageLength)
        Writes out a payload message.
        Parameters:
        message - contains the message to be written out. It will be completely consumed.
        messageLength - the number of bytes in the message. It must match the actual number of bytes in the InputStream.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes any buffered data in the framer to the sink.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Indicates whether or not this framer has been closed via a call to either close() or dispose().

      • close

        public void close()
        Flushes and closes the framer and releases any buffers. After the framer is closed or disposed, additional calls to this method will have no affect.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Closes the framer and releases any buffers, but does not flush. After the framer is closed or disposed, additional calls to this method will have no affect.
